edu.jsu.mcis

Class CommandLineArgument

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.jsu.mcis.CommandLineArgument
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Argument, OptionalArgument

    public abstract class CommandLineArgument
extends Object
    The CommandLineArgument class represents the abstraction of a general argument that can be parsed from the command-line. This class provides Optional and Positional Arguments with methods for specifying title, values that can be restrictive if the user desires, description, data type, and setting the number of expected values for an argument.

      • getDataType

        public CommandLineArgument.DataType getDataType()
        Returns what data type the argument can hold. This is used when the program checks to make sure the argument and value have matching data types when adding a value to the argument.
        Returns:
        the data type of the argument

      • addRestricted

        public void addRestricted(Object arg)
                   throws IncorrectTypeException
        Adds a set list of values an argument is restricted to using.
        Parameters:
        arg - the value the argument is restricted to
        Throws:
        IncorrectTypeException - - if the data type of the argument and of the value do not match

      • setNumberValues

        public void setNumberValues(int number)
        Sets the number of values an argument has. This is used when parsing the values to make sure the argument receives all of the values it is supposed to.

        If the number of values is set to zero ('0') then the argument becomes a flag argument and will receive no values.

        Parameters:
        number - the number of values the argument can hold

      • getNumberValues

        public int getNumberValues()
        Returns the number of values an argument has
        Returns:
        the number of values the argument can hold
